posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You have some nice ideas and i like that. Not easy to discover fresh things after these many years and thousands of builds after all

But you know why you have not seen any such builds?

Because they would not be good, not without any bonus epic feats at all, and trying to focus in three things at the same time. You would have to start with spread your abilities thin since you would need CHA too in your build.

Much better is to focus in two aspects in your build and use Bard only for the Tumble bonus and qualification for PM. There are one-two such builds that try to do that right in the ECB archives although none is optimal. One that strikes me as a good one though is this --> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 15642.html

Or if you want to try something slightly different but with 7th lvl spells try this --> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 05716.html


Finally, forget at all going DEX-based in such a build. You already gain tremendous amounts of AC by going with a full Tumble class claded in Plate armour and having PM bonusses, you would negate the only advantage you would have by not having Damage at all.. And even if you went DEX-based, you dont have Uncanny Dodge to protect you, neither Sneaks or any other method of doing real damage.

Repeat after me, STR-based is the way to go in almost all builds until you hit a High magic world. There forget about STR at all cause the 10d12 damage properties (or more) of your weapons will take over your damage needs for good.

Bonuses to both DEX & INT would make a fitting Assassin, other than that Wizards or Sorcerers are welcome too. Holy or (Unholy) builds can get some benefits from the added CHA there too. A (Bard/ BG/ RDD) would benefit from that for example but like i said at first, Assassins are where you will get the most out of it, DEX would advance your AB while INT would make your Death attacks harder to resist. Does this +2 lvl adjustment includes the famous Drow spell resistance too? Or is it only for the stat bonusses? Better include the spell resistance or else it is hardly worth it from a power-gaming point of view.

But if i were you, i would play my Barbarian and be proud for him, maybe here is the chance to make a proper "Ryld Argith", to do that trust on your stat enchancements and start with maximum strength. Something along the lines of STR 18 DEX 12 CON 12 INT 16 WIS 08 CHA 10 (Including the stat bonuses) and simply go cleave some heads from their shoulders, the difference would only be 1 AB anyway, nothing to prevent you from doing this if you have a strong character concept

Am i right that you want this for Arelith perhaps? This is the server i most frequently hear about Drows. Sadly Arelith will prevent you from getting the most out of a full STR Barbarian cause they disable Devastating Critical, but you can always terrorize those Priestesses with your Terrifying Rage! Just remember, a Fun Barbarian is always a full Strength one, just trust in your innate DR and don't stray from pumping that Strength of yours, higher and higher. With your enhanced Intelligence you can take all Barbarian skills too, so don't forget about Taunt & Listen, because Drow continuous search ability goes well with the last & Taunt can give you extra situational AB.

posts.author: JimDandy
posts.content:
Haha, sweet I also came across this intriguing build on the old forums, that had neat things going for it. http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 56086.html

The only changes to Barbarians on Dor is the Raging, as follows (and, lol, if you can make sense of the Damage Resistance formula, PLEASE enlighten me, hahaha):
arbarian Rage Previous bonuses to str and con replaced by:
+1 ab and damage for each 2 str the rage previously gave.
+1 temp hp per level for each 2 con the rage previously gave.
+1 fort save for each 2 con the rage previously gave.
and additionally:
DR of 3/- +2((barb-1)/6)+2/3 of Epic DR feats DR.
Movement increase of (barb lvl/4)* previous str increase/2 %.
No ac penalty.
Taking the feat mighty rage changes all rage uses to the new bonus.

The barbarian I have in mind needs a ton of DR (the 3 epic ones), and Mighty rage (I think that has to be level 20 or 21). After that, I don't know how many levels I really need. Terrifying Rage is character level based, as I understand it, with the focus coming from the Intimidate skill, once you have the feat taken, at a Barbarian level in epics (I presume).

I'll always go two-hander, even though the build I just linked is a tank. I like the crippling strike, skills, and sneak attack features. Not sure how they will end up measuring against a RDD or PM version (I am kinda reluctant to try the PM because of character concept, and tbh it's a stretch to go RDD, too - but this is all for fun *shrug*). I have looked at a lot of other barbarian builds, and I'm not sure others appeal to me; other than pure barbarian where it's rather straight forward with awesome DR, HPs, and whatnot. FWIW, I'm doing a half-ogre Barbarian 28/ Bard 2/ RDD 10 now, because I wanted to see what it was like, with a greataxe, great cleave route, and additional +2 STR and +2 CON applied after character creation (-2 INT extra, too, IIRC). It is so much fun... and I'm just level 14 barbarian, not multi yet. Just love not dying!

Pale Master

Those are some great rules man, it seems you are playing in a strong server where things like PM's have even get a boost. The inclusion of PM lvls for duration and caster lvl is nothing short of amazing!

As far as Barbarian Rage goes here is how it works, at least as i understand it. I will take as base a pure Barbarian with EDR 3 & Mighty Rage.

From your Mighty & Terrifying Rage you will get the following:

1) +6 AB/ +6 dmg

2) +240 temporary hp's

3) +6 Fortitude save

4) No AC penalty at all

5) +30% Movement Speed

6) DR: 21/-

And they leave you with 3 lvls of freedom that you can take something else without affecting these bonusses, as benefits stop at 37th Barbarian lvl. Of course you would loose The last Epic Barbarian bonus feat, but something like (Barbarian 37/ FTR 1/ ROG 2) would give you the above plus Heavy Armour for free plus UMD plus Evasion plus +4 AC from full tumble Ranks, and would take back your lost Epic feat from the FTR bonus one provided you take all these lvls at Epics.

The build you linked is also a good one, that's why i said there are many possibilities

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
When i said Mighty-Terrifying Rage i also meant Greater too. I went with a pure Barbarian with EDR 3 and the Mighty Rage feat for my calculations. The DR won't go up more from lvl 37 and onwards. The formula is Barb lvl -1/6 so it's 6*6=36 lvls but you need 37 becase of the -1 there. You were partly right to think that would be +7/+7 (14/2) if those bonuses were stacking actually to their fullest but NwN engine limits them to the +12 ENCH Value so it is +6/+6. Except if your server takes the real values as its base , then its even more awesome and yes you do take +7/+7 and actually all the bonuses go up one notch, including the temporary hp's to 280 and Fortitude save at +7 more!

Have fun!
